page.title: 09HARDWICK-PLACES OF INTEREST
page.content: { Hardwick Hall}is obviously the major place of interest (see{page 6).}Also within the area, at{Stainsby,}there is the site of an old{moated manor.}An old{schoolhouse}now stands on the site and is now used as a short-stay residence for pupils at a Bradford school. There is also a non-working {mill}at Stainsby which is a recently restored{listed building. In the area close to Hardwick Hall is a{medieval wood,}still untouched and a source of great interest and information for visiting students. To the east of Hardwick Hall is the {keeper's cottage}referred to in{"Lady {Chatterley's Lover"}by{D.H.Lawrence. Nearby Norwood Lodge,1739,is being restored. Ault Hucknall church is noteworthy, particularly for its annual well-dressing-flower pictures. {
